Caustic
export namespace
Caustic
Module

import Imaging.Image.Image

EImageType
enum
EImageType

Defines the types of images we currently support.

Parameters
Unknown

type is undefined

BW_1bpp

type is black/white image with 1 bit per pixel

Gray_8bpp

type is grayscale image with 8 bits per pixel

Gray_16bpp

type is grayscale image with 16 bits per pixel

RGB_24bpp

type is RGB image with 24 bits per pixel

RGBA_32bpp

type is RGBA image with 32 bits per pixel

RGBX_32bpp

type is RGBX image with 32 bits per pixel (X is ignored alpha)

BGR_24bpp

type is BGR image with 24 bits per pixel

BGRA_32bpp

type is BGRA image with 32 bits per pixel

BGRX_32bpp

type is BGRX image with 32 bits per pixel (X is ignored alpha)

Float_32bpp

type is floating point image

Float4_128bpp

type is floating point image with 4 channels

NV12_4_2_0

YUV format using 4:2:0 sampling (see https://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/YUV YUV420)

Module

import Imaging.Image.Image

IImageBase

Base interface shared across all image types

Module

import Imaging.Image.Image

Functions
GetImageType
virtual EImageType GetImageType() = 0

Returns the type of data stored in the image

GetData
virtual uint8* GetData() = 0

Returns a pointer to the image data

GetWidth
virtual uint32 GetWidth() = 0

Returns the image's width in pixels

GetHeight
virtual uint32 GetHeight() = 0

Returns the image's height in pixels

GetSubX
virtual int32 GetSubX() = 0

Returns the X offset into our parent image (if this is a subimage)

GetSubY
virtual int32 GetSubY() = 0

Returns the Y offset into our parent image (if this is a subimage)

GetParent
virtual CRefObj<IImageBase> GetParent() = 0

Returns the parent image. This is only not nullptr if the image is a subimage of another image.

GetBPP
virtual uint32 GetBPP() = 0

Returns the image's bits per pixel

GetStride
virtual uint32 GetStride() = 0

Returns the image's stride (bytes/scanline)

IImage

Interface to an image (CPU based)

Module

import Imaging.Image.Image

Functions
Clear
virtual void Clear() = 0

Erases the image (setting it to black with full alpha)

Clone
virtual CRefObj<IImage> Clone() = 0

Makes a copy of the image

Returns

Copy of the image

TakeDataOwnership
virtual void TakeDataOwnership() = 0

If the image was created with a pre-existing block of image data, this function will transfer ownership of that data to the image class.  After calling this the Image class will be responsible for deleting the data when the image is detroyed. Otherwise, the app will be responsible for freeing the data.

SetPixel
virtual void SetPixel(
int32 x,
int32 y,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

Sets a pixel in the image. This method assumes the underlying image is BGRA.

Parameters
x
int32

pixel's X coordinate

y
int32

pixel's Y coordinate

color
uint8[4]

color to set pixel to

SetPixel

int32 x,
int32 y,
uint8 gray
) = 0

Sets a pixel in the image. This method assumes the underlying image is gray scale.

Parameters

pixel's X coordinate

y
int32

pixel's Y coordinate

gray
uint8

color to set pixel to

int32 x,
int32 y,

y

DrawCircle
virtual void DrawCircle(
Vector2& center,
uint32 radius,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

Renders a circle on the image

Parameters
center
Vector2&

center of the circle in pixel coordinates

radius
uint32

radius of the circle (in pixels)

color
uint8[4]

color used for rendering the circle

const Vector2& v0,
const Vector2& v1,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

) = 0

IIntegralImage

Interface to an integral image (see https://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/Summed-area_table)

import Imaging.Image.Image

Functions
GetSum
virtual uint32 GetSum(
int channel,
int x1,
int y1,
int x2,
int y2
) = 0

Returns the sum of the requested area

Parameters
channel
int

which color channel to sum

x1
int

top left corner's X coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

y1
int

top left corner's Y coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

x2
int

bottom right corner's X coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

y2
int

bottom right corner's Y coordinate (in pixel coordinates)
